title: Smart Factory Dashboard using IIoT (Industrial IoT)

content.text: This project involves deploying an End-to-End Industrial IoT (IIoT) Data Pipeline to elevate machine data management on the production floor.

The core objective is to establish a reliable and highly efficient infrastructure to ingest data from Sensors/PLCs via the IoT Gateway, utilizing the Cloud (V-NET) for reliable real-time data acquisition. The system then stores this Time-series data in a central database. We leverage Node-RED/Backend to manage the necessary logic for preliminary analysis and automated alerts, thereby providing the team with the tools required for rapid monitoring and troubleshooting.

Data Ingest: IoT Gateway (V-Box), Cloud (V-NET) and Node-RED
Database: Microsoft SQL
Backend: Node/Express
Frontend: React + Recharts

Historical data query (SQL)
Alert notification (LINE Notify)

1. Data Acquisition (Edge Layer): Sensors/PLCs capture raw operational data and transmit it to the IoT Gateway (V-Box).
2. Data Ingestion (Cloud Upload): The V-Box pushes data securely to its proprietary Cloud (V-NET) service in real-time, utilizing the V-NET protocol.
3. Data Processing and Storage: Node-RED connects to the V-NET Cloud API to pull/receive the data, processes it, and writes the Time-series data into the Microsoft SQL database.
4. Alerting and Notification: Node-RED or the Backend monitors for Alert Conditions and immediately triggers a notification via LINE Notify.
5. Data Visualization (Dashboard): The Dashboard (React) requests data from the Backend (Node/Express), which queries Microsoft SQL and uses Polling to simulate a real-time view.
